image.altText: A police hat and a bouquet of flowers sit atop a coffin draped in an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Vadim de Waart-Hottart, one of two officers killed in a shooting in Victoria's north-east last week, has been farewelled at a police funeral with full honours in Melbourne today.

title.children: Church packed as three thousand people farewell officer slain in Porepunkah shooting

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Thomas Sewell will remain behind bars until he faces court on charges related to an attack on Camp Sovereignty over the weekend.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader denied bail over Camp Sovereignty attack

image.altText: Man standing in sheep yards with sheep

props.synopsis: The Victorian government says it cannot confirm how many sheep and lambs have been killed by dingoes in the state's north-west since it introduced restrictions on lethal control measures.

title.children: 'Defeated' Victorian farmers look for answers as livestock losses mount

image.altText: A woman standing inside an unfinished house

props.synopsis: Prosecutions against home builders are rising sharply in Victoria, with the new regulator warning consumer protection measures will be "on steroids".

title.children: Prosecutions against Victorian builders surge as regulator gets 'proactive'

image.altText: An accident scene with police and vehicles.

props.synopsis: Police say the two women were struck by a vehicle on the Hume Freeway at Craigieburn on Thursday night.

title.children: Two women killed while trying to help injured animal on Melbourne freeway

image.altText: A former AFL coach speaks behind a microphone in 2017.

props.synopsis: AFL premiership coach Mick Malthouse recounts the terrifying moment three masked men attempted to break into his East Melbourne apartment.

title.children: 'It went into the chest': Malthouse recounts terrifying home invasion

image.altText: A machete

props.synopsis: Victoria's ban on machetes has begun, but a closer look at the law behind it reveals a broad definition for them.

title.children: Victoria's machete ban creates confusion over knife definition

image.altText: A colourful processional dragon inside a museum dedicated to Chinese artefacts.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne couple accused of damaging numerous precious items in Bendigo by "sprinkling" vegetable oil thought the substance would simply wash off, a court has been told.

title.children: Alleged vandals were 'blessing' historic artefacts with oil, court hears

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: Police have charged another three men with offences related to the attack on Camp Sovereignty over the weekend, bringing the total number of men charged to seven. Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell is being held in custody over the incident.

title.children: More arrests over Camp Sovereignty attack that left multiple people injured

image.altText: A group of people standing for a photo

props.synopsis: The former Victorian premier has defended a decision to travel to China for a military commemorative event, saying a constructive relationship with Australia's largest trading partner was in the country's national interest.

title.children: Daniel Andrews addresses controversial Beijing group photo

image.altText: The Victoria Police crest, badge, on the arm of an officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives are investigating what they believe is a "targeted attack" after a 20-year-old man turned up to a west Melbourne hospital with gunshot wounds early this morning.

title.children: Police investigate 'targeted' fatal overnight Melbourne shooting

image.altText: A couple stand in an apartment looking into camera with a serious expression. One is holding a cat.

props.synopsis: A year after they moved into an "affordable" apartment in a new public-private housing development in inner Melbourne, Alix and Tiarn were told their rent would increase by 17 per cent. They say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

title.children: 'Affordable' housing tenants face $55 per week rent increase

image.altText: A dead fish on a river bank

props.synopsis: The Anglesea River — a tourism drawcard on the Surf Coast and place of pride for locals — has seen repeat fish kills in recent years, with both residents and experts at a loss as to restore the river's health.

title.children: The neon green river killing fish on Victoria's surf coast

image.altText: A LGBTQIA+ flag blowing in the wind by the Murray River.

props.synopsis: With few public LGBTQIA+ celebrations in Mildura, a community campaign for a mardi gras is gaining momentum.

title.children: Mildura considers hosting Murray River mardi gras

image.altText: A bidder throws up a H sign at an auction

props.synopsis: Some of Victoria's most exclusive heritage number plates have new owners after an auction saw buyers spend millions of dollars.

title.children: Victorian number plate sells for $650k as buyers spend big at auction

image.altText: A young boy smiling

props.synopsis: A woman who lost control of her SUV and crashed into a group of students at Auburn South Primary School, killing a boy, has been convicted and fined $2,000.

title.children: Driver fined $2,000 and disqualified after death of Melbourne student

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Police say the 32-year-old, who was already on bail for separate charges, poses an unacceptable risk to the community.

title.children: Neo-Nazi to face bail decision on Friday after arrest over alleged attack

image.altText: Dezi Freeman pictured outside a court in Wangaratta.

props.synopsis: As the search for Dezi Freeman continues, former police officers say the public should not be surprised if it goes on for months.

title.children: Former officers say police have the advantage in Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows head coach Matthew Nicks has said suspended star Izak Rankine is "in a pretty good space" following his return to the club after an overseas break.

title.children: Rankine addresses Crows teammates after returning from overseas break

image.altText: A photo showing Ibac Independent Broad-Based Anti-Corruption Commission Victoria on the windows of its Victorian office.

props.synopsis: A former councillor has been charged with receiving secret commissions and misconduct in public office while a property development consultant has been charged with giving secret commissions.

title.children: Two charged after corruption investigation into Melbourne council

image.altText: GettyImages-2215403064

props.synopsis: St Kilda confirms Jack Silvagni will be offered a free-agency deal for 2026, meaning the former Blue will link up with his famous father.

title.children: Silvagni shuns Carlton as rival confirms free-agency deal will be offered

image.altText: An artefact — seemingly a vessel with an animal's head on the front — made from black basalt.

props.synopsis: Victorian company Palmanova loses its High Court battle over the possession of a pre-Columbian basalt artefact, bought from an American gallery in 2020.

title.children: Victorian company loses court bid to keep pre-Columbian artefact

image.altText: A car park with cars covered in snow, against a snowy mountain background, with a man in snow gear in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Victoria's alpine businesses celebrate a strong snow season that has attracted more visitors and put local companies "back in the black".

title.children: Businesses praise best snow season in years for Victorian resorts

image.altText: View of head and shoulders of pilot in open air plane with white dog, smiling at camera.

props.synopsis: From the wilds of the Great Australian Bight to the thrill of low-altitude crop dusting, pilot Kevin Warren has lived his dream job for six decades.

title.children: Commercial pilot retires at 83 after six decades in the sky

image.altText: A close-up of the face of a greyish-brown elephant seal lounging in shallow water.

props.synopsis: Sammy the seal often pops up in the seaside Victorian town of Portland and has recently been photographed munching on a shark. He is loved by many, but authorities are warning people to keep their distance.

title.children: Shark-eating seal returns to Portland, prompting warnings for admirers

image.altText: A man behind the bar pouring a beer from a tap.

props.synopsis: As the manhunt continues for the gunman who allegedly killed two police officers in north-east Victoria, businesses are beginning to feel the impacts.

title.children: Businesses hit by manhunt for alleged Porepunkah gunman call for support

image.altText: A person in a hazmat suit holds a dead bird on the edge of a lake.

props.synopsis: Experts are on edge, fearing this will be the spring that the "catastrophic" H5 strain of bird flu arrives in Australia.

title.children: 'Time of trepidation' as bird flu risk increases in Australia in spring

image.altText: A bald man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue tie walks along a street with tv cameras surrounding him.

props.synopsis: Notorious drug kingpin Tony Mokbel smiles at reporters as he arrives at Victoria's Court of Appeal where he is seeking to overturn drug trafficking convictions from two decades ago.

title.children: Tony Mokbel's appeal begins with former prosecutor in crosshairs

image.altText: A couple stand in front of the Grand Canyon

props.synopsis: A new administrator's report has revealed Traveldream paid another company to secure flights, accommodation and tours for customers, which has now gone into administration itself.

title.children: Travellers face heavy losses after agency and supplier go under

image.altText: An artist's render of a development at Melbourne's Queen Vic Markets

props.synopsis: The redevelopment of the 150-year-old Queen Victoria Market has been described as the "biggest renewal" in its history with thousands of new homes promised, but some critics say the plans don't do enough for affordability.

title.children: Why advocates say this iconic market site must be redeveloped

image.altText: Man stands in front of a large drum of cable.

props.synopsis: The $5 billion Marinus Link undersea power cable project to connect Tasmania and Victoria passes two major milestones, with financing locked in and suppliers ordered start production on key components.

title.children: Secured financing locks Marinus Link in, with contractors given go ahead

image.altText: A ripe wheat crop with a blue sky and white clouds.

props.synopsis: A federal government forecaster says the value of Australia's agriculture, fisheries and forestry is on track to reach a record value of $101 billion this financial year, a target previously set for 2030.

title.children: Value of Australian agriculture, fishing and forestry set to top $101b

image.altText: A man in a high visibility shirt, vest and a cap, measuring a pane of glass resting on the back of a truck.

props.synopsis: As tradespeople work long hours to meet demand and fewer school leavers choose apprenticeships, industry leaders say Australia does not have the workforce to meet its ambitious housing goals.

title.children: Glazier working 90-hour weeks warns housing targets may be unachievable

image.altText: A mother and her four adult children, one in a chair, are grouped together in front of Christmas trees.

props.synopsis: Emma Trenerry's family, community and footy club have raised tens of thousands of dollars to buy the terminally ill 32-year-old more time with her kids.

title.children: Mother's heartbreaking mission to buy more time for her dying daughter

image.altText: A young white man in an orange cap and matching racing suit smiles and makes a 'number one' gesture with his right hand

props.synopsis: Formula 1 is having a moment — and so is Oscar Piastri, the Australian driver who is currently topping the leaderboard. As the race to the championship heats up, now is the perfect time to get up to speed.

title.children: Your shortcut guide to F1 and Oscar Piastri as the championship race heats up
